title: Here's a reading list of 20 articles on the evaluation of large language models (LLMs), focusing on benchmarks and frameworks. These articles span up to 2024 and cover various aspects of LLM evaluation
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** by Jacob Devlin et al
A foundational paper introducing BERT, which has influenced many subsequent benchmarks and evaluation methods
**"GLUE: A Multi-Task Benchmark and Analysis Platform for Natural Language Understanding"** by Alex Wang et al
Introduces the GLUE benchmark, widely used for evaluating LLMs
**"SuperGLUE: A Stickier Benchmark for General-Purpose Language Understanding Systems"** by Alex Wang et al
An extension of GLUE with more challenging tasks
**"XTREME: A Massively Multilingual Multi-task Benchmark for Evaluating Cross-lingual Generalization"** by Alexis Conneau et al
Focuses on evaluating multilingual LLMs
**"Beyond Accuracy: Behavioral Testing of NLP Models with CheckList"** by Marco Tulio Ribeiro et al
Proposes a framework for testing NLP models beyond traditional accuracy metrics
Pre-training Text Encoders as Discriminators Rather Than Generators"** by Kevin Clark et al
Introduces a new pre-training approach and discusses its evaluation
**"The GEM Benchmark: Natural Language Generation, its Evaluation and Metrics"** by Sebastian Gehrmann et al
Focuses on evaluating natural language generation models
**"Dynabench: Rethinking Benchmarking in NLP"** by Douwe Kiela et al
Proposes a dynamic benchmarking platform for continuous evaluation
**"Evaluation of Transformer-Based Models on Biomedical Question Answering Benchmarks"** by Wenhui Wang et al
Evaluates LLMs specifically in the biomedical domain
**"Beyond the Imitation Game: Quantifying and Extrapolating the Capabilities of Language Models"** by Ethan Perez et al
Discusses methods for quantifying LLM capabilities
**"BIG-bench: A Large-scale Evaluation of Language Models on Diverse Tasks"** by Jason Wei et al
Introduces the BIG-bench, a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating LLMs on a wide range of tasks
**"Measuring Massive Multitask Language Understanding"** by Dan Hendrycks et al
Proposes a benchmark for evaluating LLMs on a variety of tasks simultaneously
**"The HELM Benchmark: Holistic Evaluation of Language Models"** by Percy Liang et al
Aims to provide a holistic evaluation framework for LLMs
**"Prompting GPT-3 To Be Reliable"** by Ethan Perez et al
Discusses evaluation methods for prompting-based interactions with LLMs
**"Evaluating Large Language Models Trained on Code"** by Mark Chen et al
Focuses on the evaluation of LLMs in the context of code generation and understanding
**"The State of AI Ethics Report"** by The Montreal AI Ethics Institute
Provides insights into ethical considerations and evaluation frameworks for AI, including LLMs
**"Evaluating the Robustness of Language Models to Adversarial Attacks"** by Eric Wallace et al
Discusses methods for evaluating the robustness of LLMs
**"Scaling Laws for Neural Language Models"** by Jared Kaplan et al
Examines how LLM performance scales with model size and data
**"The Pile: An 800GB Dataset of Diverse Text for Language Modeling"** by Leo Gao et al
Introduces a large dataset and discusses its implications for LLM evaluation
**"Towards a Standard for Identifying and Mitigating Harmful Outputs of Large Language Models"** by Margaret Mitchell et al
Proposes standards for evaluating and mitigating harmful outputs from LLMs
These articles provide a comprehensive overview of the current state of LLM evaluation, covering various benchmarks, frameworks, and methodologies
